segments.text: Let's look at some early features of QuickCall.
We've got GitHub and Slack connected. All integrations are ready to use.
Let's list our GitHub repos and Slack channels and pick where to send updates.
We didn't specify which repo or channel to use. So Claude Code asks us for that input.
Once we provide the inputs, the MCP tool call runs.
Here's the MCP server pulling open PRs from GitHub and pushing them to Slack.
Four PRs sent. The team knows what needs review.
The MCP server can also read messages from Slack channels.
Here are all the messages from the last 24 hours.
Now let's generate a summary of recent git activity.
24 commits, 494 lines changed, all broken down by what was worked on.
Send this summary to Slack and you're done.
These are just the early features. More coming soon.
Try it out and tell me what you want to see next.
Stay tuned and stay in the zone.
